intro: Acinodendron tenue, commonly known as the slender acinodendron, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that are edible. Acinodendron tenue is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along streambanks.
